title: 103_s690
content: The Act is titled the "Modified Line Item Veto/Expedited Rescissions Act of 1993." It introduces expedited consideration of certain proposed rescissions in the Congressional Budget and Impoundment Control Act of 1974. The "Modified Line Item Veto/Expedited Rescissions Act of 1993" allows the President to propose rescinding budget authority provided in an appropriations Act within 3 days of enactment. The President must transmit a special message to Congress with a draft bill specifying the amount of budget authority to be rescinded. The "Modified Line Item Veto/Expedited Rescissions Act of 1993" allows the President to propose rescinding budget authority within 3 days of enactment. The President must send a special message to Congress with a draft bill specifying the amount of budget authority to be rescinded, including details outlined in section 1012(a). The President must also send separate messages for accounts under different subcommittees of the Committee on Appropriations. The "Modified Line Item Veto/Expedited Rescissions Act of 1993" allows the President to propose rescinding budget authority within 3 days of enactment by sending a special message to Congress with a draft bill specifying the amount. The limitation for rescinding funds for a program, project, or activity is 25% of the appropriated amount, and specific authorization is required. Additionally, procedures for expedited consideration in the House of Representatives are outlined. The "Modified Line Item Veto/Expedited Rescissions Act of 1993" allows the President to propose rescinding budget authority within 3 days of enactment by sending a special message to Congress with a draft bill specifying the amount. On the third legislative day after receiving the special message, any Member of the House of Representatives may introduce the bill, which will be referred to the Committee on Appropriations. The committee must report the bill without substantive revision and with or without recommendation by the seventh legislative day. If the committee fails to report the bill within that period, it will be automatically discharged from consideration. The "Modified Line Item Veto/Expedited Rescissions Act of 1993" allows the President to propose rescinding budget authority within 3 days of enactment by sending a special message to Congress with a draft bill specifying the amount. Any Member of the House of Representatives may move to strike proposed rescissions if supported by 49 other Members. A vote on final passage of the bill must be taken in the House of Representatives within 10 legislative days. A motion to proceed to the consideration of a bill under this section in the House of Representatives is highly privileged and not debatable. Debate on a bill in the House of Representatives under this section shall not exceed 4 hours, divided equally between those favoring and opposing the bill. Appeals from decisions of the Chair regarding the Rules of the House of Representatives on a bill under this section shall be decided without debate. The procedure for a bill under this section in the House of Representatives shall be decided without debate. Consideration of the bill will follow the Rules of the House of Representatives. A bill transmitted to the Senate will be referred to the Committee on Appropriations, which must report the bill without substantive revision within seven legislative days. Failure to report the bill within this period will result in automatic discharge from consideration. During Senate consideration, any member can move to strike proposed rescissions with support from 14 others. A vote on final passage must occur within 10 legislative days. If passed without amendment, the bill is returned to the House. If amended solely as provided, an engrossed amendment is sent to the House. During Senate consideration, a motion to proceed to a bill under this section is privileged and not debatable. Debate on the bill and related motions shall not exceed 10 hours, divided between the majority leader and the minority. Debate in the Senate on any debatable motion or appeal in connection with a bill under this section shall be limited to 1 hour, divided between the mover and the manager of the bill, with additional time allotted by the leaders if needed. A motion to further limit debate on a bill under this section is not debatable. The bill under this section is not debatable, and a motion to recommit is not in order. No amendments or divisions are allowed, except in specific cases. Any budget authority proposed for rescission must be available for obligation the day after a defeat in either House. The bill under this section is not debatable, and a motion to recommit is not in order. No amendments or divisions are allowed, except in specific cases. Any budget authority proposed for rescission must be available for obligation the day after a defeat in either House. Definitions for terms like 'appropriation Act' and 'legislative day' are provided. Amendments are made to Section 904 of the Act regarding rulemaking powers. Conforming amendments are made to Section 1011 of the Act. Amendments are made to Section 1011 and Section 1015 of the Act, updating various paragraph numbers and references. Amendments are made to Section 1011 and Section 1015 of the Act, updating paragraph numbers and references. Section 1016 is also amended to include reference to section 1014. Amendments are made to sections 1011, 1015, and 1016 of the Act, updating paragraph numbers and references. Section 1016 now includes a reference to section 1014. Additionally, clerical amendments are made to the table of sections for subpart B of title X of the Act. "Section 1013 addresses expedited consideration of certain proposed rescissions."
